application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The Oak tree can be viewed from between the properties (44 and 42) and has a moderate amenity value.
Along with other nearby trees the Oak helps to provide a gradual transition of mature tree cover between the dwellings in Copsewood Way and the nearby Ruislip woods National Nature Reserve (NNR)
The Oak contributes to local biodiversity, and to the amenity and arboreal / wooded character of the Copsewood Estate Area of Special Local Character.

No reasons have been provided as to why the work is required. The Oak appears to be in good health and thinning by as much as 30% as well as reducing one side would likely lead to "lion-tailing and created a lopsided crown. It would also unnecessarily introduce multiple wounds into its crown, which would likely cause stress and lead to infection, affecting its long-term health; this would affect the safe useful life expectancy of the tree.
